intro: Canthium trichophorum, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually simple and alternate, with a hairy texture that gives it its common name. Canthium trichophorum typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides.
